column12:
You are about to complete a series of questionnaires measuring facets of behaviour and mental health. Some of the questionnaires may cover emotionally and psychologically sensitive issues. 
            These are used for research purposes and are not used for a medical diagnosis.

Before completing these questionnaires, please feel free to take a short break if needed. You may also change the size of your browser to make the questions easier to read.

When you are ready to continue, please read and confirm the following statements:

I confirm that I have read and understand the information sheet for this study. I have had the opportunity to consider the information, ask questions and have had these answered satisfactorily.


If you still have questions about the research, please ask the experimenter or email axs2210@bham.ac.uk before completing this form.


I understand that my participation is voluntary and that I am free to withdraw at any time without giving any reason.


I understand that once my data have been included in analysis, after approximately one month, I will not be able to withdraw my data.


I understand that my data will be treated confidentially and any publication resulting from this work will report only data that does not identify me. 

My anonymised responses may be shared with other researchers or made available in online data repositories.


I freely agree to participate in this study.

column18:
This measure assesses the way that social phobia plays a role in your life across a variety of
situations. Read each question carefully and answer how it applies to each situation. 

The first question asks how anxious or fearful you feel in the situation. The second question asks how often you avoid the situation. If you come across a situation that you ordinarily do not experience, we ask that you imagine "what if you were faced with that situation," and then, rate the degree to which you would fear this hypothetical situation and how often you would tend to avoid it. 

Please base your ratings on the way that the situations have affected you in the last week. Fill out the following scale with the most suitable answer provided below. - Telephoning in public.

column138: Please rate the degree to which you agree with the following statements. - I keep getting in trouble for the same things over and over.
column139: Please rate the degree to which you agree with the following statements. - Every now and then I carry a weapon (knife or gun) for protection.
column140: Please rate the degree to which you agree with the following statements. - You can get what you want by telling people what they want to hear.
column141: Please rate the degree to which you agree with the following statements. - I never feel guilty over hurting others.
column142: Please rate the degree to which you agree with the following statements. - I have threatened people into giving me money, clothes, or makeup.
column143: Please rate the degree to which you agree with the following statements. - A lot of people are "suckers" and can easily be fooled.
column144: Please rate the degree to which you agree with the following statements. - I admit that I often "mouth off" without thinking.
column145: Please rate the degree to which you agree with the following statements. - I sometimes dump friends that I don't need anymore.
column146: Please rate the degree to which you agree with the following statements. - I purposely tried to hit someone with the vehicle I was driving.
column147: For each statement, say whether it applies to you or not. - Are you easily confused if too much happens at the same time?
column148: For each statement, say whether it applies to you or not. - Do you frequently have difficulty in starting to do things?
column149: For each statement, say whether it applies to you or not. - Are you a person whose mood goes up and down easily?
column150: For each statement, say whether it applies to you or not. - Do you dread going into a room by yourself where other people have already gathered and are talking?
column151: For each statement, say whether it applies to you or not. - Do you find it difficult to keep interested in the same thing for a long time?
column152: For each statement, say whether it applies to you or not. - Do you often have difficulties in controlling your thoughts?
column153: For each statement, say whether it applies to you or not. - Are you easily distracted from work by daydreams?
column154: For each statement, say whether it applies to you or not. - Do you ever feel that your speech is difficult to understand because the words are all mixed up and don't make sense?
column155: For each statement, say whether it applies to you or not. - Are you easily distracted when you read or talk to someone?
column156: For each statement, say whether it applies to you or not. - Is it hard for you to make decisions?
column157: For each statement, say whether it applies to you or not. - When in a crowded room, do you often have difficulty in following a conversation?
column158: For each statement, say whether it applies to you or not. - Are there very few things that you have ever enjoyed doing?
column159: For each statement, say whether it applies to you or not. - Are you much too independent to get involved with other people?
column160: For each statement, say whether it applies to you or not. - Do you love having your back massaged?
column161: For each statement, say whether it applies to you or not. - Do you find the bright lights of a city exciting to look at?
column162: For each statement, say whether it applies to you or not. - Do you feel very close to your friends?
column163: For each statement, say whether it applies to you or not. - Has dancing or the idea of it always seemed dull to you?
column164: For each statement, say whether it applies to you or not. - Do you like mixing with people?
column165: For each statement, say whether it applies to you or not. - Is trying new foods something you have always enjoyed?
column166: For each statement, say whether it applies to you or not. - Have you often felt uncomfortable when your friends touch you?
column167: For each statement, say whether it applies to you or not. - Do you prefer watching television to going out with people?
column168:
Thank you for completing the questionnaires! Before you finish, would you be interested in completing the same study (task and questionnaires) again in a few weeks?


If you select 'Yes', this does not mean that you will be automatically take part, as we will select participants who are interested at random.
